segments.pli: “Katinaṃ nu kho, bhikkhave, indriyānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā khīṇāsavo bhikkhu aññaṃ byākaroti:
segments.en: “Mendicants, how many faculties must a mendicant develop and cultivate so that they can declare enlightenment:

segments.pli: ‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānāmī”ti?
segments.en: ‘I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence”’?”
“Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. …”

segments.pli: “pañcannaṃ kho, bhikkhave, indriyānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā khīṇāsavo bhikkhu aññaṃ byākaroti:
segments.en: “A mendicant must develop and cultivate five faculties so that they can declare enlightenment.

segments.pli: ‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānāmīti.

segments.en: The faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pañcannaṃ indriyānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā khīṇāsavo bhikkhu aññaṃ byākaroti:
segments.en: These are the five faculties that a mendicant must develop and cultivate so that they can declare enlightenment:

segments.pli: ‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānāmī”ti.
segments.en: ‘I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence”’.”

suttaplex.blurb: Having developed faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom a mendicant may declare their awakening.
